Posts.Content: I have just watched it and found it much more realistic and true. It will get harder for her as she goes along but I do hope that she carries on with the videos to show people what really happens. I used the cold cap also and it was horrible for the first ten minutes but I am so glad that I carried on with it. I wish her good luck with everything.
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: Victoria Derbyshire's video blog really annoyed me as everybody's experience is different and having to lose a breast is not easy mentally! Did she have a recon? Lucky for her if she did as she would have woken up with a 'breast' again. Not every lady gets that because of further treatment which is needed. Some of us wake up from the op to find it all gone, totally flat as a pancake and that is tough. If she needs chemo then I don't think that she will find that so easy. If she keeps doing a blog then I just hope that she thinks a bit more before she opens her mouth or writes it down.  The treatment is very hard and we do it because we have to for a chance to stay alive. Sorry for the rant.
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: Very true Cathy. It is a very long journey getting through all of this and not easy at all. xx
Posts.Title: Anybody else been Victoria Derbyshired????????

Posts.Content: Hi Mand, I finished my chemo last September and used the cold cap. I am pleased that I did as I kept 70% of my hair. It is very cold and the first ten minutes are the worst but after that it was ok. However it does add another hour on to the treatment time. I would say to you, try it and see how you get on. I wish you the best of luck with everything. Xx
Posts.Title: COLD CAP OR NO COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: Hi B, I am asthmatic and chemo never made that worse. Take all your anti sickness meds and hopefully you will not feel sick but the fatigue does kick in on day 5. Plenty of sleep is then needed and make sure that you drink the two litres of fluid per day. Good luck xxu
Posts.Title: 1st chemo, how soon for side effects to show

Posts.Content: I live in Norfolk and was only told about using condoms,ha!ha! Last thing on my mind.
Posts.Title: Chemo and bodily fluids

Posts.Content: Happy Easter to everybody and hope that you are all enjoying the sunshine. I feel much better than I did this time last year! Xx
Posts.Title: Easter hugs

Posts.Content: So true!
Posts.Title: After Taxotere...

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, glad that it went well today and that the tumours are shrinking well.  I do hope that you don't get all of the bad symptoms which they have told you! My nurse just said that everybody is different and many women can cope with just paracetamol so we shall see. I had my third FEC yesterday so first T isn't until the 29th June. Keep us informed about how you feel this week and which meds help you. Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: I am now thanks.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, good luck for tomorrow and we shall all be in the Neddy's club soon! Full roast sounds lovely and I have felt that my body cries out for meat during the chemo. It needs the iron and vitamin B12 I suppose. Enjoy you afternoon and let us know how you get on.   xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, you sound very up beat so must be feeling OK after your last FEC. My bloods were back to normal today so I am all set for FEC 3 on Monday, half way! Then it will be on to T. Love the jokes. xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: So sorry to hear of your loss especially when you are going through all of this. Hope that the T doesn't hit too badly but as you say, can see the light at the end of the tunnel now! Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Daffodil, I have had three FEC chemos so far and did use the cold cap. I have posted what I think previously so have a look at that. I find the fatigue and bad taste the worst things so you do have to sleep and drink a lot, at least 2 litres per day. Take all of the medication which they give you as I found that the anti sickness pills did work for me. Listen to your body and be kind to yourself.  Good luck xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Brenda, that is good news about your five embryos! You now know that they are there for you in the future. Some of the head gear does look very nice.  I have a couple of turbans and a scarf which is attached to a small hat. This makes it easier as I am rubbish a tying scarves! The hair thing is horrible but we shall all end up with full heads of hair and possibly in a different colour and texture! xxxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Would you believe that I have never had a crispy creme! Are they as delicious as they look? xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Hev, well done! Gosh I bet you feel so relieved to get the chemo all done. I am half way so cannot wait! Good luck with your further treatments. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Definitely George! x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: I have also been upset by the lack of real support from two of our oldest friends! Not even a card, flowers or chocolates since January when I was diagnosed. Just the very odd phone call to my husband asking how things are going. Some people just cannot face the scary big C but all we want is a few kinds words and a visit now and again. There, that's my rant over for the day! I also agree fully with the small things in life now meaning so much. The colours in the garden and the birds singing is so lovely. It's good that everybody seems  to be feeling so positive. Enjoy the day. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, glad that you are not too bad after Mr T and the last three weeks seem to have flown by. Have you been tired since day 1? My first T is on Monday and I wish you well for T2 and the Herceptin on Tuesday. Does that mean that you will only have one left after that? Loved the ice cream joke! Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Welcome home Debbie! I think that a few of us have had some problems this time but hopefully we shall all get through it. I asked about the veins as I have only one useful arm and onco said that they would put in a central port if needed.  You must rest up now and get your energy back for the 15th June. Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: You will be able to tell us what to expect! xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks Amanda, that helps me a lot. I hope that I am the same as the FEC has been horrible until about day 9. I am now on my good week and feel great!  I am usually quite active and cannot wait to get back to yoga and swimming! Just off to have some Reiki with my yoga teacher.  xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Lee, I have been using the cold cap and have lost some hair on the top of my scalp and around the edges. This is where the cap doesn't fit as well. The hair follicles do get tender before the hair comes out. Don't worry as you will still have some hair but will have to wear a hat in the sun so that you don't get burnt.  I have had 3 FEC and will start 3 T at the end of the month so will carry on using the cap.   I do not have a PICC line as so far my veins have been OK. My hospital only uses them if they have to and it is not routine. Strange how hospitals do things differently. Love xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Oh dear, it sounds as though it is a tearful day today! xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi everybody,  we all seem to be having some problems at the moment and emotions appear to be running high. Crying is good as you must let it all out and our hubbies and partners have broad shoulders! Little bit of good news, on day 8 post FEC and woke up with a bit of energy! Managed to actually get out in the garden this morning to do some weeding. It was lovely in the sunshine listening to the birds singing. Hope that everyone feels better soon. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi bm84, I and a few other girls have used the cold cap so I will tell you about that. It is extremely cold and helps to close down the capillaries to the hair follicles thus stopping the chemo reaching them.  I will say that when they put it on you feel you will not cope with it but honestly after a hard ten minutes your body does  get used to it and I have managed to use it for my three FEC chemos. I have lost some hair on the top of my head and around the sides but probably still have 60% of my hair.  I do wear a hat or a scarf when outside as the sun would burn my scalp otherwise! I bought some headgear from Seasalt, Buff and my hospital's cancer centre plus a huge sun hat! You must be in complete shock at the moment but we are all here for you. Lots of love and luck xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Brenda, my heart goes out to you and hope that all goes well on Wednesday. xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Hev, I live in Norfolk and Blakeney is one of my most favourite places to go. You will have a fabulous time. Yes, I do miss my Cromer crabs this year. cannot wait until I can have one again.  xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, that all sounds positive and as Trish has said I am also glad to get rid of the FEC! I am oestrogen positive so will be starting Tamoxifen after the chemo. Hope that your Herceptin goes OK and you will not have to stay in so long next time.   Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Mags, I forgot that your Mum had her chemo moved to another day.  I thought that it was today. Great news that the lump has shrunk, Mr T did what it was supposed to do! FEC does mess up the taste buds I am afraid.  Strong flavours and spicy food help plus pineapple seems to be good. I found that the first week was hard because of the fatigue so tell Mum not to try and do too much.  After day 9 I felt better and the last week before chemo I felt completely normal. Drink loads, sleep and moisturise! Good luck for Friday.    Love to you both. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Hev, that is the problem with having chemo on a Monday, the weekend gets in the way! I should really have my blood tests tomorrow but there is nobody to take the blood then. Hopefully it will be OK on Monday. xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Happy birthday Mags, hope Mum is OK. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Or an old man on a push bike! xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: I have a 24 hour SOS number to ring if any problems. A nurse on the oncology ward carries a mobile phone around with them and they will answer any questions. If necessary you then go straight to the ward to see a doctor. I am surprised that this isn't the case everywhere. I hope that you manage to talk to somebody Von. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Sorry that you are feeling unwell today Sarah. Have you got somebody that you can phone for advice? xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: That's good, hope that you feel better soon. xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Von, best of luck for tomorrow! The waiting for it to start is the worst bit but you will feel much better about it after tomorrow. I have had 3 FEC so far and then I shall have 3T. The worst thing for me is the fatigue and bad taste but just sleep and drink loads! As for driving, when I am on all the pills days 1 to 4 I do not drive much, just down to the village is as far as I go. After that I feel OK to go further a field. Just listen to your body.  Love xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Just got back from having first T and it went well and I feel OK at the moment. I shall be dosed up on steroids for the next couple of days and then wait to see whether I get hit by the man on a bike or the truck!  Good luck to everybody having treatment this week.   xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Oh dear, the T doesn't sound very nice so not looking forward to that at the end of the month! I do hope that you all get over the bad days and have some good days soon. As you say, getting near to the end now thank goodness. I am FEC 3 day 5 and still feeling very tired. Managed to drive to the shop but that will be about it for today!  xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin , I do hope that they manage to get blood from you soon! I don't have a PICC line but my veins are starting to go to sleep now so had to hold my arm in a bucket of hot water yesterday to wake them up! The nurse said that she found a nice juicy one on the side of my hand after that. No doubt that will have gone to sleep next time! I ended up watching some taped TV this morning. Lots of love to you too. xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Morning everybody.  This is a tough time for all of us at the moment but we are getting through it slowly and we shall kick this BC in the butt! Keep going and I hope that things ease for all of us. I had a meltdown this morning, poor hubby got a very wet shoulder! xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Yes please from me too xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Hev, yes, it always gets me on about day 7. I think that after a week I am so fed up with the horrible taste and tiredness that it just all comes out and the drugs really do play up with your brain cells. I am sure that we are normal as you cannot be brave all of the time, not that I really like that word as we do not have a choice do we?  xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, how are you? We haven't heard from you for a while, hope you are OK. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Yes, the strap is very tight but  I do have it so that I can eat and drink OK. Pain relief is a must to stop the 'brain freeze'!  I have about 70% of my hair after three FEC and I could do with a trim around the edges now.  xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi BrackenB, welcome to our forum and so glad that you are finding it helpful.  I don't think that I could have coped with the chemo without all of these lovely people! It made me feel that I was not alone. Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Well here I am wide awake at 5am on all the steroids! I have the very fetching 'tomato face' at the moment.  It looks like it is going to be a lovely day and I am just thinking about doing the ironing. Anybody else awake? xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Nadjie, the expander and implant is perhaps my thinking for the future.  I too didn't like the look of the back flap etc. I cannot have fat taken from my abdomen, although I have plenty to spare, as I have had a hysterectomy so too big a scare there. Does the implant feel quite natural? I totally agree that this site has been a life saver for me too. I think that the depression could have set in without all of you lovely ladies.    The sun is shining so have a good day. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks Nadjie that helps. xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi George, I do not appear to be getting the e-mail notifications from the June Chemo Club even though it is ticked in my set up.  Any ideas why this is? Thank you
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Von, I too am allergic to Penicillin and Trimethoprim so yes it does make it more difficult for them but it is not our fault! I am of the age when I was pumped full of penicillin as a child for tonsillitis.  That is what they did in the 60s so consequently I developed an allergy.  Thank God for Clarithromycin as they seem to give that to me for everything now. I do hope that you get better soon.  These problems really do get us down as we all just want to get it over and done with! xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, I cannot take brufen either as I have acid reflux! I did manage post op with just paracetamol every four hours.  I am certainly the problem patient as they cannot use my left arm for anything at all because of the nodes having been removed. I was worried about that so have managed to get an emergency alert band to put on that arm just in case! If anybody is interested I shall post the company. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Lee, so sorry to hear about all of your problems. Many of us seem to have had a bad time during the past two weeks. A good cry does help. Hope that they get you sorted for next time and that you feel better soon. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: I do hope so! xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, I have had a lovely weekend thanks and I do hope that FEC3 will be easier for me as the last one wasn't very nice. i wish you loads of luck with your first T and hopefully it will not be too bad. Poor you still having periods, they must be horrible to deal with. I am past all that thank goodness. love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: FEC 3 done today so half way now! Next time I shall meet Mr T for the first time, hope that he is kind. Good luck to everybody having treatment this week. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: The fatigue is still bad and I cannot wait until day 9 when hopefully I shall start to feel more human! Mr Tesco is about to deliver my shopping so I will have to summon up some energy to put that all away. Hope that everybody is improving. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Has anybody heard from Kazza? I am concerned as we haven't had any jokes for ages.  I do hope that she is OK.
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, lovely to have you back and sorry that you ended up with the dreaded infection. I do hope that you stay well for the last two Mr Ts and as you say, nearly there!! I cannot say that I am looking forward to my first Mr T on the 29th. Have a relaxing weekend.  Sending lots of love xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Happy wedding anniversary and Father's Day. Enjoy it and as for the longest day, where is summer? I still had my socks on yesterday! Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Congrats to your daughter Nadjie.  You must have felt so proud last night! xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin, thanks for that information about Mr T. It has made me feel about about my first one next Monday. Which pain meds did you take as like you I cannot take Ibuprofen. Was paracetamol enough? I loved the jokes, good to have them back again!  Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks Nadjie, let's hope that he is kind to us! I shall be on Tamoxifen after chemo has finished. xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Had my blood test done today, ready for Monday and the neutrophils are too low. So I am going to have another one done before treatment on Monday to see whether it can go ahead.  This will mean that I may be taking all the steroids on Sunday and Monday morning for nothing. Hopefully they will recover over the weekend and I shall be OK, fingers crossed! xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi karin, glad that you have the sunshine in NI, it has been raining here in Norfolk. Isn't it annoying that you feel good just before they do it all again, but you are nearly finished! Tamoxifen and Herceptin are different.  If your cancer cells have oestrogen receptors then you would be prescribed Tamoxifen as this will block any rogue cancer cells taking up oestrogen and using it to multiply. If you have high levels of HER2 receptors on your cancer cells then you will be prescribed Herceptin.  This will help to block the effect of this receptor and encourage your own immune system to kill any abnormal cells. The NHS choices site is good for this. Hope that helps. Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Hev, I totally agree with you about trying to do things on the bad fatigue days so I take my hat off to Nadjie for being so active! I still have about 70% of my hair at the moment but will see what happens after this T chemo. It will be a good break for you to have a holiday after the chemo and best of luck for the op. They told me to think about a recon after all of the chemo and rads is over.  I am a bit older than most of you ladies so not sure whether I even want another op, we shall see how I feel after Christmas. I cannot believe that we have all been here since April and it is July tomorrow! Time is moving on and we are all getting through this, well done everybody. xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Hev, I have already had the mastectomy and lymph node removal and I do worry about the future with possible lymphodoema too. My bad arm does already look slightly different to my good arm and that will be something which I shall have to talk to the surgeons about before any possible op. When do you think you will have the op? xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hello, I just need a few calming words from everybody because at the moment I have a bad case of the jitters about my op on Monday.  How will I feel when I wake up?  How much discomfort will there be?  My hospital lets you go home the same day if you are OK.  Hubby is worried about that! Love ChrissieC
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Thanks for all that information. xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Hello again, the drain came out today, hooray!  I had three nurses here as mine had never done one before plus a student.  We thought of having a party but hubby didn't fancy it!  Anyway I feel ten times better now that I can move about more freely and have already had a walk around our Close in the sunshine. Thanks to you all. Love ChrissieC xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Thanks Jacqueline that has helped. xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Hello everybody, I am back again after a night in hospital due to the morphine making me sick.  I still have the drain bottle attached but that will come out tomorrow so hopefully I shall feel much more free then.  It was a horrible experience but everybody was very kind and it does amaze me how quickly the body does heal.  My surgeon uses glue and no dressing so I saw the scar straight away which was a shock but it got it over and done with quickly.  I am as flat as a board on that side now!  I cannot have any reconstruction until I have finished all of the treatment as I need chemo plus radium.  Hubby is being a star and looking after me.  Love him to bits!   Love ChrissieC xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Thank you everybody and I shall let you know how I get on. Love ChrissieC xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Hi Kate, how are you feeling now and when did your drain come out? Hope that you recover quickly. ChrissieC x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: To everybody who has replied to me a very big thank you.  You have all helped to settle my mind I am so glad that I came on this forum.   xx
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: I too had tears in my eyes whilst reading the paper by Peter Harvey. That is just how I feel at the moment.
Posts.Title: Getting back to "normal"

Posts.Content: Hi Birty, I also find days 3 and 4 worse for the joint pains but it does ease after that. A warm bath and the pain killers help me but it is horrible. T does seem to affect the temp more than the FEC did but hopefully you will be OK.  xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Von, so glad that you are feeling better and that you had a good weekend. The body is actually very good at recovery and the blood cells come back quite quickly. The half way point is important as it is downhill from there! It was my hubby's birthday yesterday and doing something completely normal like a family lunch is wonderful for the soul.  xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: It is very quiet on here! Hope that everybody is OK. xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Janet, so sorry to hear about your Mum.  I hope that you get your treatment moved to make your life a bit easier. With your bleeding, best to ask for a blood test to check your platelets as they could be low. xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Jo, yes, I got the same thing with T but it is wearing off now and I still have my nails. Just keep moisturising them and hopefully they will be OK. xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: It was a brilliant day out and for 8 hours I managed to forget about all of this and be normal! I now have the dates of my rads. I start on the 2nd September and finish on the 22nd and that will be a party day!! xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: No, the car is mine ha! ha! My old car wasn't going to get through it's next MOT so I had to do something quickly. As I have had a mastectomy I have no nipple but I'm worried about the rads on my skin. Lots of moisturising I expect. You will be nearly finished this time next week! I shall tell Hevbo. xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Von, goodness I would have gone mad without a TV! As for the eye ticks I have had them with T. They were very annoying but thankfully they have gone now.  Hope that you feel a bit better. xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Brilliant that you are feeling better Von. A friend bought me an adult colouring book too so I am going to have a go this afternoon. Have you only two chemos left?  xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I developed the arm swelling 6 months after my operation and was referred to a specialist nurse. The compression sleeve, glove and the daily gentle massages have helped a lot. Now there isn't much difference between my arms but I am still wearing them every day. If it is caught early it can be managed. Just remember not to lift anything heavy with the affected arm.
Posts.Title: Swelling in arm

Posts.Content: Sounds lovely for you and we really make the most of our good week. Sadly I found the T much worse than the FEC but others may have been luckier. I have my very last chemo next Tuesday, hooray! xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Oh thanks so much Ali! What ever happens at least it is the last one, hooray!!! Lots of hugs to you and everybody having chemo this week. We are strong!! xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thank you George and Jackie and thank you so much for the huge support which you have given all of us. I for one would never have got through this so well without everybody on this forum. Lots of love and hugs to you all! xxxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Yes, here you all are! Thanks for carrying on with the clubs Amanda. Karin, I did say what a cutie little Skye is in the July club but I shall say it again here, gorgeous! I have a wig which I haven't used but it was free for me. The money came from donations to the cancer unit which was kind of them. xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Good luck for tomorrow Susie and everybody else having chemo. xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Von, you really have had a horrible time with the T! I have been in hospital for 14 days over five cycles and have one more to go. Like you I have a bag packed and I hate taking my temp after the chemo as I dread what it will be. Hopefully for you they have now killed the bugs in your bowel and you will be fine over the following treatments. I also cannot wait to repopulate my bowel with good bacteria. xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Last chemo done and dusted, hooray!! So pleased and just hope that the GCSF injections keep me out of hospital this time.
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Iz, just had my last chemo and personally I found the T worse than the FEC. Luckily I didn't get any of the nausea with the FEC but just take all the meds which they give you. How are you finding the T? xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: I will Carol as you have all been a great support to me.  I shall pop back now and again to see how you all are getting on.  xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi everybody, just to let you know that I have heard from Hevbo and her op went well. She is a bit battered and bruised but OK and has a new boob! I have been making the most of my good week before my last chemo and got to day 1 of The Ashes at Trent Bridge! What a brilliant day out that was. Also bought a newer car and out for hubby's birthday on Sunday.    xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Bloods all OK so last chemo, hopefully forever, tomorrow!!  Hooray! Just hope that I manage to stay out of hospital this time and I am well enough next Monday for my rads planning. xxx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: You poor thing Vonnie, I know what you have been going through as I was the same. It is very frustrating and boring being stuck in one room.  I do hope that you had a tv as at least that is something to do. I hope that you get fully rested and your other chemos go better.  xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thank you George.x
Posts.Title: Full Range of Breast Cancer Related Books To Read or Download

Posts.Content: Happy Christmas to everybody and a better 2016! I too would not have got through all of my treatment without this forum. Thank you for your support!
Posts.Title: Christmas Wishes
